page.title: 01WARE,HERTFORDSHIRE.
page.content: WARE,HERTFORDSHIRE. {Ware}is a small town with a rapidly expanding population.Situated in the Lea Valley,twenty one miles north of London and three miles from the shire town of Hertford its growth can be attributed to its position in the commuter belt with easy road and rail access to London.The largest single employer is the pharmaceutical company Glaxo. The high street retains many of its original buildings dating back hundreds of years and the town was declared an outstanding conservation area by the Historic Buildings Council in 1973. Recently much residential building has taken place on the outskirts of the town. {Ware}since 1971 has been twinned with Wulfrath, West Germany.
